text:
**Simplified Text:**

**Garbage and Costs**

In many places, families throw away garbage, and it is often free for them. They pay for garbage collection through local taxes. But this is not fair. A big family with a lot of garbage pays the same as a small family with little garbage. 

When people throw away more garbage, it costs more to collect it. More trucks and workers are needed. If garbage collection is free, people will throw away too much. A good idea is to make families pay for the garbage they throw away. This can help them recycle more and throw away less.

Some towns in America have tried this. They sell stickers that families put on their garbage bags. Only bags with stickers are picked up. In one town, Charlottesville, people paid 80 cents for each sticker. 

At first, it seemed to work. The number of garbage bags went down by 37%. But people found a way to fit more garbage into each bag. They jumped on the bags to make them smaller. This is not a good way to reduce garbage. 

In another study, it was found that charging for garbage did reduce the amount of garbage, but not by much. For example, if the sticker price goes up by 10%, the amount of garbage only goes down by 0.3%. 

People in richer towns throw away more garbage than in poorer towns. They also have less time to recycle. 

So, charging families for garbage is not a bad idea, but it is not a simple solution. The effects of these rules can be complicated.

**Work and Life**

Theodore Zeldin talks about how our work life can change. Do you feel respected and appreciated at your job? Success is not enough anymore. Many people feel their work is not valued. Even famous people can feel unhappy. 

Loving your job used to be enough, but now you should think about how your job affects you. Does it help you grow as a person? If your job makes you boring or too busy, then money and status will not make you happy. 

Zeldin wants to find ways for work to be more fulfilling. Work should not just be about making money. It should help us live better lives and meet new people. But, changing work will not end unemployment. More educated people want jobs that are interesting and helpful.

Even jobs that used to be good, like doctors and architects, can be stressful. Many workers feel unhappy and do not connect with their jobs. In Britain, only 8 out of 100 workers feel their values match their company’s values.

Zeldin is studying different jobs to see how they affect people. He wants to find better ways to earn a living. Many experts focus on making companies richer, but we also need to think about ourselves as people. 

How many of us feel truly alive at work? Some people feel like they are stuck in their jobs, even if they can leave. For example, many hotel workers are smart and lively but have low pay and long hours. Hotels could be more than just places to sleep. They could be places where people from different countries meet and share experiences.

Hotel workers could use their skills to make hotels better. If hotels listened to their workers' dreams, they could offer more services. But often, they only focus on making money.

Zeldin believes work is about relationships. Many people want to feel free at work. They should be able to create their own jobs and choose their coworkers. This means they need to learn to talk to people from different backgrounds.

Good communication is important, but it is not the same as real conversation. Real conversation helps us understand each other better and creates respect. When we have these conversations, we can change the world, even a little bit.

**BROADCASTING: How Technology Affects Society**

The word 'broadcasting' comes from farming. It means to spread seeds widely. This idea is about growing things in a big way and getting a good harvest. Broadcasting needs a central place to send out information, like seeds from a bucket.

We need to think about why a new technology that sends words and pictures was set up like this. Television is connected to other ways to communicate, like the telegraph and telephone. But from the start, television was made to send information to many people from one central place. This fit well with how society was changing at that time.

There were some other ideas about how to use television. In the 1930s, some people in Britain tried to make two-way television, like a video phone. They wrote articles in science magazines about how to build television machines. Many people tried to experiment with this. But big companies took over and made rules that pushed these small inventors out. This was a missed chance for television to be a more equal way for people to communicate.

In the early 1930s, television was mostly watched in public places, not at home. In Britain and Germany, many people saw television together in groups. The idea of small, two-way television was not successful. Instead, companies wanted to sell television sets for homes. As people had more money in the 1920s, they wanted their homes to have entertainment. This is now happening all over the world.

There is a link between how society changes and how broadcasting works. As society modernized, power and money became more concentrated. People moved around more, which made them feel more alone compared to earlier times when communities were stable. Centralized broadcasting helped governments share important information with everyone. It also helped create a sense of community in the nation.

Broadcasting became the main way to share information through radio and television. However, there is also a positive side to broadcasting. It can help democracy by giving everyone access to important information. 

Television is changing now, and the word 'broadcasting' might not fit anymore. It may only refer to a specific way of sharing information during a certain time in history.

**Clutter**

Sometimes, it feels like no matter how many things you have, you still do not feel safe. It is normal to want a home that is good for you. But sometimes, we want too many things. Advertisements make us feel like we need more. They tell us that if we do not have certain things, we are not good enough. 

Next time you walk down the street, try not to look at any ads. They are everywhere: on TV, radio, newspapers, magazines, posters, t-shirts, and the internet. They all tell us to buy more things.

**Caves**

Many scientists study caves. They want to know where caves come from, how water moves in them, and what lives in them. Caves are interesting and make us curious. Many people study caves because they are important in nature. 

However, visiting caves can be hard. This means that many people who study caves are not just scientists but also people who visit caves for fun.

**Weather Watch**

A long time ago, people started to study the weather just by watching. Now, we have many tools like satellites and computers to help us understand the weather. These tools give us a lot of information very quickly. 

Sometimes, the words used to talk about the weather are very hard to understand. But our own experiences are still very important. What we see and feel helps scientists make weather forecasts.

**MUSIC AND THEATRE**

I used to think that opera is mainly theatre. Now, I think it is more about music. I worked at a national opera house and learned that music is the most important part. I come from the world of theatre, where words and actors are very important. In theatre, the audience and the actors usually understand each other well.

At music performances, like concerts or operas, many people do not know much about music. Some feel embarrassed about this. Most people admire the musicians' skills. Even a good musician has worked very hard to get better. Watching great musicians is like watching athletes. We know running for a bus is similar, but athletes are much better.

Theatre audiences have different expectations. They do not always understand how hard acting is. They may not be impressed when an actor says a long speech. People often ask actors, "How do you learn all those lines?" This does not mean theatre audiences are less demanding than music audiences. Many people enjoy both.

I think music can learn from theatre. I have seen how a different approach can make concerts better. Live music is very emotional and can connect with the audience. However, music performances often have strict rules, like dress codes, which can make the audience feel less important.

Sometimes, music audiences clap between songs, which can interrupt the performance. This is often a way to show appreciation, but it can also disturb the flow of the music.

Many people are working to bring new audiences to concerts and operas. They want to show that "serious" music is for everyone. I remember a special event called "In Search of Angels." It took place in a cathedral and outside in the town. It was a great musical experience, and many audience members felt they were part of it.

I wish music could be more exciting and different, like the best theatre. Sometimes, using unusual places for performances can create amazing experiences for both performers and audiences. It might be uncomfortable, but theatre audiences are often brave and willing to try new things.

I know that many plays are still performed in traditional ways, but I believe music performances can change too. I love both theatre and music, and I want more people to enjoy them like I do.

**Sand**  
I think sand is not very nice. It can be useful for making things like glass and concrete, but I don’t like it at the beach. Sand gets in my face, my food, and can even hide my keys and coins. When I am wet, sand sticks to me and is hard to wash off. But when I step on a towel or walk on a clean floor, the sand falls off easily. Even days later, I find sand in my shoes and socks. I don’t want sand around me.

**Lock and Key**  
People have always wanted a safe home. A long time ago, they used simple locks. Now, we have electronic locks that use cards. But many people still like to use a real key. They feel safer with a key in their hand. One company made a new electronic lock, but they also added a real metal key. 

**Modern Art**  
I was nervous to visit the new Tate Modern gallery because I don’t understand modern art. I like some art, like furry things and bright lights, but I wish I knew more. The important thing is to enjoy the art, not to write about it like in school. This gallery helps visitors understand the art better. They have good labels that explain what the art means. Now, I can understand the art more than before.

**Every Picture Tells a Story**

Making movies from books is not easy. It often means taking away parts of the story. This can be hard for the writer, but it can also help them see things in a new way. When I wrote a script, I saw that I could remove a lot of words and still tell the same story. This does not mean the words in the book were not important. It is just different for movies and books. In a book, we often repeat things to help the reader remember. In a movie, we can see who is talking without always saying "he said" or "she said." 

**Watching Movies**

When we watch movies, we can feel like we are in another world. For a little while, we forget about our real lives. But when the movie ends, we come back to reality. Some people think movies are just for fun and not real art. Many older people, like our parents and teachers, did not think movies were important. They liked to be entertained, but they did not see movies as art.

**The Film Studios**

The Leiper Film Company studios had many buildings. It was hard to find your way around. There were three main doors, but they all looked the same. It was confusing for new people. But most people who worked there knew where to go. Because of their hard work, people could enjoy stories of love and adventure in movies. 

**Film-Makers**

Many people want to make movies. There are many books and classes about how to do it. Some people even win cameras to help them make their films. Robert Rodriguez made a movie called El Mariachi for $7,000 and became famous. He wrote about how he wanted to make a great film before he turned 26. 

In the past, it took longer for people to make movies. They worked in different jobs first, like editing or writing. John Huston was 35 when he made his first film. Now, many new film-makers have to do it on their own without help from big studios.

In the past, there were many council houses on the west side of the city. These houses were small and not very nice. In summer, there was a bad smell from a factory nearby. In the morning, a paperboy often looked unhappy as he walked to deliver papers. I don’t remember much from my early life, but I do remember sitting by a window and looking at the houses far away. I also remember my mother. She was small and often angry. I didn’t understand why she was angry, so I couldn’t make her feel better.

My mother liked to go to small shops. She was a very lonely person, even in a room full of people. She had strict rules about how to behave. For example, we should not go into our neighbors' gardens or touch their flowers. We had to sit quietly at the dining table and listen to the radio. There were many rules, and I didn’t understand them.

My mother had some friends. There was Mrs. Buddery, who loved the Royal Family, Mrs. Winall, who didn’t say much, and Mrs. Laband, who was more lively. They often talked about their problems, like bad legs and cold weather. I felt like I was part of their talks, even when I didn’t want to be.

Growing up in West Earlham was not easy. When I was little, I stayed at home until I was five. I remember playing on the floor while my mother sat in a chair, looking unhappy. After I turned five, I went to school half a mile away. Some kids had mothers who rode bikes, but my mother let other kids take care of me on the way.

I remember summer holidays when I saw a little of the world outside West Earlham. There was an old man next door who told stories about his life at sea. One time, there was a charity event where a kind woman gave out lemonade. She wanted me to join a group to help others, but my mother said no because she thought they just wanted money.

My mother often talked about how people wanted money. She didn’t like politicians at all. She thought they were dishonest. I might be too hard on her, but she didn’t show much kindness.

Sometimes, my mother took me to the Norwich Castle Museum on Sundays. We would go on the bus, and I had to wear my best clothes. We looked at paintings together. My mother didn’t mind this, and she even made a joke once about a painting of a Roman soldier. It was a rare moment of fun with her.

**Philadelphia Avenue**

I walked down Philadelphia Avenue on the odd side of the street. It was getting dark, and the air was wet and cool. I knew this street well. I remembered my neighbors, the Matzes and the Pritchards, and Han Kieffer's grocery store. I also remembered the Krings and the Pottses, where my first friends, all girls, lived. 

The houses on this street were special to me. I noticed small things, like the little channels in the cement that took rainwater from the roofs to the street. I liked to ride my roller skates and scooter there. As the street went down, the houses looked different. The porches were lower, and the yards were smaller. 

Over the years, things changed. Some wooden parts of the houses were replaced with iron. Some houses became stores, and some stores became homes again. I wondered how people lived in these places that used to be stores.

Rick Gilbert is a furniture designer. He lives in a flat that used to be a curtain warehouse. His flat has big doors and brick walls. He did not want his flat to be empty. He wanted to have separate spaces for living and working. He used a big piece of plastic to make a hallway and hide his office. He wanted his kitchen to be a place where he could cook for friends or make coffee for clients. 

He chose light wood for the floors and mixed modern chairs with old furniture from his parents or markets.

**Bruce Chatwin**

Bruce Chatwin was a writer who loved to travel. His life was full of secrets and stories. He wrote a famous book called *In Patagonia* in 1977. This book changed travel writing. It was exciting and full of imagination. 

Chatwin sometimes changed facts in his stories to make them better. He believed that traveling could help people discover new histories and adventures.

**Swimming**

One summer day, it rained a lot. I ran across my lawn and jumped into the pool. I swam back and forth, watching the raindrops make bubbles in the water. The best part was when the rain got stronger, and I could not hear the birds anymore. 

During this time, I thought about swimming across Britain. I wanted to follow the rain to the sea. I felt tired of swimming in the same place, like a tiger in a cage. 

Many places today have signs and labels. This makes the world feel less real. Walking, cycling, and swimming help us feel free and discover the wild parts of our world. A swimming journey would let me see the mysterious parts of nature.

**Crying**

Charles Darwin thought that crying did not have a clear purpose. But now, scientists think differently. They say crying is important for social connections, especially between mothers and their children. Many people believe that children cry because they feel helpless.

It is harder to understand why adults cry. The sound of crying is not as important as what we see when someone cries. In the past, crying may have helped people trust each other and feel close.

People cry for different reasons. We might cry when we feel sad for someone who is treated unfairly. Sometimes, we cry without meaning to when we hear beautiful music or see a touching speech. We may also cry when we watch a sad movie, and this happens more when we are with other people than when we are alone.

Crying is important in social situations, and scientists are still studying it.

**The Heat is On**

We all know about global warming. It means the Earth is getting warmer. But how much warmer will it get? And how will this change our lives? Many people have some idea about global warming, but they are not sure what will happen because of it.

A warmer Earth will change the weather everywhere. This will affect plants, animals, water, and soil. Humans use these natural resources to grow food, build cities, and live. If these resources change, it is a big problem.

In the last 100 years, human actions have made the air warmer by adding gases. These gases are connected to global warming. Scientists say that the Earth has warmed by about 6 degrees Celsius in the last century. Most scientists believe this warming is not natural and is partly because of pollution.

Scientists use computers to predict what will happen because of global warming. These computers help them understand temperature, pressure, and other weather factors. But these predictions are not always perfect.

Most people agree that the Earth will change faster than before. Predictions say that by the year 2100, the average temperature will go up by 1 to 3.5 degrees Celsius. Sea levels will rise by 15 to 95 centimeters. There will also be more extreme weather, like heatwaves, floods, and droughts.

These changes will affect nature and humans. For example, forests and grasslands may move to new places. This will change the plants and animals that live there. It can also affect food, water, and where people live. Some changes may be bad, but some may be good. 

In Australia, for example, wheat production has increased because of warmer temperatures. Fewer frosts mean better harvests. But many changes will not be good. Less water will be a problem, especially in dry areas. 

In some places, like the Mediterranean, there is less rain now. In southern Portugal, rain is falling more in autumn and winter, and less in spring. 

Another problem is melting ice. This will change the land and water where animals live. The Arctic ice is melting, which can make it easier for ships to travel but also more dangerous.

The biggest problem may be rising sea levels. Warmer water takes up more space, and melting ice adds to this. Many people live near the coast, so rising sea levels can cause flooding. Cities like London, New York, and Tokyo may be affected. Many people could lose their homes.

Small island countries are at the greatest risk. If sea levels rise too much, these countries could disappear. This would be a big loss for the people and their culture. It would also create many refugees who need new homes.

Text: 'Mission to Mars

Wanted: a married couple for a trip to Mars. The trip will take 501 days. The couple must be healthy and strong. This is for the first astronauts to go to Mars if Dennis Tito's plan works. The trip will start on 5 January 2018. 

The spacecraft will go to about 160 km above Mars. It will use Mars' gravity to come back to Earth. This is important because it saves fuel. The trip must happen in 2018 because the next time Mars and Earth are close is in 2031. 

There is a lot of work to do to make new technology for this mission. If the spacecraft is ready, it might go to Mars. Even if it does not go, the work will help for future missions.'

**AESTHETICS**

Art is important, but sometimes it is hard to understand. People often think of art as just a painting, a statue, or a book. But art is more than that. It is about how we feel and experience these things.

When art is very famous, people forget where it came from and how it affects our lives. This makes it hard to see why art is important. Art becomes separate from our everyday life. 

To understand art better, we need to connect it to our daily experiences. Just like mountains are part of the earth, art is part of our lives. 

If we want to understand art, we should look at the simple things around us. We can enjoy flowers without knowing about plants, but to really understand them, we need to learn about soil, air, and sunlight. 

Many people enjoy things like movies, music, and comics, but they do not always think of these as art. When people think of art only in museums, they miss out on the joy in everyday experiences. 

Art is best appreciated when it is connected to our daily lives and activities.

**Observing Lions**

Lions are big cats that live in groups. They hunt together to catch food. Many people think this is amazing. They see lions working together like a team. But after watching lions for many years, we learned that they are not always like this. 

We started studying lions in 1978. We wanted to know why they hunt together, take care of their babies, and scare other animals with their loud roars. We thought that helping each other would help them survive. But sometimes, if one lion helps too much, it can be bad for that lion. 

We thought we would find answers in two or three years. But lions often do not do much. They can be very lazy. It took us a long time to learn about their behavior. Lions can live up to 18 years, so we are only now starting to understand them.

**Pop Music Review**

Bedrock is a band that made a new album called "New Life." This album changed rock music in our country. It was different from older music. The new music was lighter and more fun. It had happy sounds and funny lyrics. 

The band wrote songs about everyday things like sunbathing and relaxing on Sundays. Some songs were sad but beautiful, like "So Low" and "To the Brink." "New Life" has 16 great songs, and all of them are good. 

**Extract from an Autobiography**

When I was a child, I loved stories about wise women called 'The Sibyl.' One story was about an old woman who tried to sell books to a king. He did not want to buy them at first, but later he paid a lot of money for three books. This story taught me a lesson about life and selling.

I was often alone as a child. I wanted to play with other kids, but they did not want to play with me. My mother told me to do something fun so they would want to join me. It worked, and I learned a good lesson.

When I had to write a travel book, I looked for places that interested me. I do not like to travel much. I prefer to think about old ruins and history.

**What Happens to Your Manuscript?**

When you send your book to a publisher, it goes into a big pile of other books. This pile is called the "slush pile." Some young people or part-time workers look at these books. They want to find something special.

If they like your book, they will show it to a senior editor. This editor will decide if your book is good and if it can sell. They will also think about how popular you are as an author. Publishers like to meet authors before they decide to publish a book.

**Advertising Problems**

In the early 1990s, working in advertising was very hard. Many businesses were struggling because of a bad economy. In Britain, in 1991, many people lost their jobs, and many homes were taken away by banks. All businesses were affected, and some lost a lot of money.

People who worked in advertising felt a lot of pressure. They had to help their companies make money, but they had less money to spend on advertising. They were told to do more with less money. At the same time, companies started to understand that they needed to make products that customers wanted, not just what was easy for them to make.

Because of this, advertising became more important. Many companies began to pay more attention to marketing. They wanted to know how to make their advertising better. However, this also made the work harder for advertising people. They had to show that their advertising was worth the money spent.

During this time, many companies wanted better advertising strategies. They wanted creative ideas and good planning. They wanted the best people from advertising agencies to work for them.

Even though advertising people were still working, they faced the same problems as their clients: how to do more with less money. The bad economy made it hard to spend money on advertising. There were also other changes, like new laws about advertising and changes in what customers wanted.

Now, more than ever, advertising people needed to make sure their advertising worked well. But help for them was not easy to find. Many companies were too busy to talk about their problems. Those who were successful often kept their ideas to themselves. This made it hard for others to learn how to do better advertising.

**The Kitchen**

When I was in university, I wanted to be a chef. This was not a common choice. Many people wanted different jobs. Being a chef is hard work. Chefs work long hours, and the job can be stressful. They do not earn a lot of money. But I still wanted to be a chef. I was not happy at university. The work was difficult, and the people were not friendly. I thought being a chef would be better. It seemed serious and honest.

I wanted to cook because I loved food. I remember eating a great meal at a famous restaurant in London. The food was amazing. I felt very happy after that meal. I wanted to learn how to cook like that. I started to focus on cooking instead of my studies. I read cookbooks, visited markets, and cooked many meals.

**Swimming Lessons**

The swimming teacher was a strong man with tattoos. He taught me how to dive. First, I sat on the edge of the pool and rolled into the water. I practiced this until I got better. The next time, he made me dive from the edge. He was strict and told me to look up and keep my legs straight. 

One week, I tried diving from a high board. It was very high, and I was scared. I took a deep breath and jumped. For a moment, I felt like I was flying. But when I hit the water, I fell awkwardly. The teacher was not happy, but I felt great. I understood what it means to be "free as a bird."

**Travelers**

Some people love to travel. They like to explore new places, even if it is dangerous. They climb high mountains and sail on rough seas. They eat strange food and live in unknown places. Some people think these travelers are strange. They live very differently from us. We like our comfortable homes and safe lives. 

**Sailing**

Jonathan Raban is a writer who is afraid of the sea. He spends a lot of time sailing. He is not the best sailor, but he enjoys it. He likes to write about his sailing adventures. His small boat has a device that tells him where he is on the sea. 

Raban thinks that using a compass is not good. He believes it makes sailors forget to look at the waves and feel the sea. He thinks the ocean is more than just a place to sail. It has life and stories. Because of this, he pays close attention to the waves while sailing.

**Holiday Reading**

Summer is a time for two great joys: going on holiday and reading books. These joys are connected. Books can help us feel at home in the world. We can see our own lives in the stories of others. Authors use words to describe feelings and situations that we may think we are alone in. They can express our thoughts clearly, helping us understand ourselves better. 

When we read a good book or travel to a new place, we see things differently. At first, we notice everything around us. We pay attention to the colors in the sky, the faces of people, and even feelings we didn’t know we had. 

**Author's Note**

These thoughts about travel were published in the Observer newspaper over seven years. I made some small changes to fit the articles, but I kept most of the original text. I also fixed a few mistakes. 

Traveling by plane has changed how we see the world. Many people can now visit places without needing special skills, just the price of a ticket. I believe that travelers are not blind to what they see. Even a postcard can have a purpose.

**Ecotourism**

The word "ecotourism" is often used but not always correctly. It started in the 1980s when people became more aware of the environment. Tour companies realized that many travelers wanted to travel without harming nature. Now, "ecotourism" can mean many things, from living with remote tribes to a short boat trip. 

The idea was to help people make good choices when they travel. But without clear rules, many travelers feel confused about what ecotourism really means.

**Transylvanian Journey**

I lost my notebook about my trip to Transylvania for 50 years. I found it again a few years ago, and it helped me remember that time. In Transylvania, I had a great time, staying in friendly homes for weeks. I thought I had nothing to write about because I was enjoying myself. 

When I moved to a new place, I sometimes forgot to write. I worried that my notes were not in the right order. But then I realized that it didn’t matter much, so I let the story flow naturally.

**Fashion**

Fashion is often thought to be new. Many people think it started in the 1800s and 1900s. But fashion has a long history. Historians say it began with trade in the 1500s and 1600s. As societies grew and changed, more types of clothes were made. This made the meaning of clothes more complicated. Now, it is hard to say what a piece of clothing means. For example, a man's suit can mean different things to different people.

**Writer**

Many people think that all writers are famous and make a lot of money. But this is not true for most writers. Some writers have other jobs and write in the evening. They need money to live. Others, like me, do different jobs like teaching and writing articles. I have heard of a job writing for a chocolate factory, but I never got that job. I write my book by working part-time and using credit cards. Sometimes, I get help from friends.

**Sudden Fame**

We started to perform in small places, and many people came to see us. We had to use secret doors to avoid fans. On days we did not work, it was hard to go outside without being followed by fans. In a few days, we became famous. Our fans watched us, and our managers took care of us. I was shy, but I also felt a strange confidence. I felt very different and confused.

**Music - The Future of Music**

Technology is changing our lives. Susan Hallam talks about how it affects music in Britain. In the late 20th century, people had more ways to listen to music. They could use radios, TVs, records, tapes, CDs, and videos. But, fewer people are playing live music, and there are fewer jobs for musicians.

More people can listen to music now, and this will continue. Music is important for everyone. There is music at big events, and it helps people in many ways. A world without music is hard to imagine. The question is not if there will be music in the 21st century, but what kind of music it will be. 

Learning to play instruments is still important. The music industry helps the economy in Britain. Playing music can help people learn other skills. Research shows that making music can help with thinking skills. Group music lessons can help children make friends and focus better in school.

Playing an instrument can also help with good habits. For example, practicing can help with studying, and playing in concerts can teach people to be on time and organized. Because of this, many people will want to learn instruments in the future.

What will music look like in the future? There are two likely changes. First, people will listen to many different types of music. New styles will mix together. Second, technology will help people make and perform music. This means more people can create music without needing a lot of skills. But, it may also mean fewer live performances.

More people of all ages will want to make music together in their communities. To prepare for this, music teachers need to change how they teach. They should help more people learn different instruments throughout their lives. 

Music teachers will need to inspire and teach students of all ages. They will also need to work well with different groups of people. This is a big change from how things are done now. It is important to show that music education is good quality.

Finally, we need to make music more important in our lives. Music is very important, but sometimes people forget this. Everyone in the music world should work together to make sure music is valued.

**The Actor's Craft**

Sometimes, people do not like actors. This can happen when actors talk about their work in interviews. Instead of explaining their art, they often use boring phrases or talk about gossip. 

An actor named Paul Scofield said that acting is best when it is done, not when it is talked about. He believed that every time an actor performs, they start fresh and learn new things. After a play, the actor feels empty until the next performance. 

**A Review of Hamlet**

Adrian Lester plays Hamlet, a young man who is becoming an adult. His performance is simple but very good. He shows a mix of anger and humor, making his character both strong and likable. You can see how he uses his body to show his feelings. 

**What is Acting?**

Acting is about showing feelings and actions. It raises questions about what makes a character come alive on stage. 

**A Director's Rehearsal Process**

One director has a special way to help actors prepare. First, they show the script on a screen. The actors listen and think about the words. When it is their turn to speak, they take a breath and remember something that helps them understand their line. They should not plan too much and should trust their feelings.

**The Perfect Theatre**

A good theatre makes you feel important. When you go to see a show, it should feel special. The people working there should care about the performance. The audience should feel close to the actors and be able to see and hear everything well. 

The size of the theatre is important too. It should fit the actors and the audience. Old theatres often do this well because they feel warm and welcoming. 

When you go to the theatre, you want to see something new and exciting. If it is not special, you might as well stay home.

**Paul Simon**

Rock and roll music in the 1950s was very popular with young people. It was important because it changed the lives of many adults too. This music helped new rock stars to grow. They listened to this exciting music and knew it would be part of their lives.

For Paul Simon, like many young people in the US, the best way to hear this new music was from a radio show called Moondog Rock'n'Roll Party by Alan Freed. Many young musicians listened to this show. Paul Simon was very interested in the music he heard and wanted to make his own music one day.

The snow looked safe, but it was not. I was surprised and scared. I climbed out of the hole and thought about what could have happened if the hole was deeper. There are many books that help researchers with qualitative research. These books talk a lot about collecting data, but not much about how to analyze it. Analyzing data can be confusing. So, we asked different social scientists to talk about how they analyze their data. We wanted to help people understand this process better. We found that explaining this is not easy. We let our contributors share their work in different ways, like personal stories and more formal writing.

**Screen Learning**

A few days ago, I saw my six-year-old son eating noodles in a funny way. He was pulling them up with his teeth and pretending to be a dinosaur. He said, "I'm a little dinosaur." He was acting like a character from a TV show. I asked him what he knew about dinosaurs, but he did not know much.

Many people like to use the internet and computers for learning. But is this a good way to learn? One father tried an interactive program with his son. The father read the words while the son played with the pictures. The father thought that if his son had read a book for ten minutes, he might have learned something.

Research shows that learning is better when there is talking with teachers or parents. It is important to use new technology to teach our children, but we still need schools and teachers.

**Hollywood**

By 1918, most movies in the world were made in Hollywood. People who lived there did not like this. They thought Hollywood was not good. But in the end, people liked Hollywood because it was successful. Success means making a lot of money from movies.

Hollywood has changed a lot. A long time ago, it was a small village with orange trees. Now, it is a big town, famous like New York, Rome, or Paris. People in Hollywood talk a lot about movies: how much money they make, who is dating who, and who is working on what project. Many successful people want to live somewhere else but still work in Hollywood. But it is still the main place for anyone in show business.

**Photography**

Photography was created by artists in the 1800s. They wanted to keep a real record of what they saw. With new tools, they could make pictures that looked very real and detailed. This surprised other artists. Some said photography was not real art because it used machines. But photographers knew they had a new way to express themselves. They used cameras like other artists use brushes and pencils to show the world around them.

**Book Illustration**

In the past, every children's book had pictures. This was also true for many novels for older children. There were many children's books, but most were made with a small budget. This meant some books were not very good, but the best artists always did their best work.

The collection of black-and-white illustrations is a mix of good and not-so-good work. It is a great place to look for interesting art. Some of these treasures will be shown to the public again, either through new books or exhibitions. There are signs that people are starting to pay more attention to these old illustrations, and soon, we may see classic children's book illustrations again.

**Blogging: Sharing Online**

A while ago, a website talked about the dangers of telling everyone where you are online. When you say, "I am here," you are also showing your location to many people. Some of these people may not be good to meet. This shows that sharing everything online can have problems.

Many people want to share their lives online. They think it can bring them money or fame. But sometimes, sharing too much can be risky. In the past, some people, called bloggers, shared their lives online. They learned about the good and bad things that can happen.

In January 1994, a 19-year-old student named Justin Hall started sharing his life on the web. At that time, the web was mostly for scientists and students. Hall wanted to share his story. He wrote a blog every day and many people read it. He wrote about everything, and he did not hold back.

One day, Hall had to stop his blog because he fell in love. His partner said he could not write about their relationship. Hall felt sad because he thought sharing his life made people not trust him.

In 2002, a woman named Heather Armstrong had a blog called Dooce. She wrote about her job. One day, someone at her work shared her blog with her bosses. Because of this, she lost her job. This shows that what we say online can affect our real lives.

Armstrong took a break from blogging but later got married and started writing again. Now, she is very popular as a "mommy blogger," and she makes money from her writing. 

The lesson is: the internet lets us say many things, but we should think carefully before we share.

**Enough Sleep?**

Many people today feel tired. In rich and busy countries, many people do not sleep well. In the USA, 40 million people have trouble sleeping. Some books in Britain talk about people who cannot sleep. 

A sleep expert says, "People need more sleep." When people are busy, they sleep less. They wake up early to avoid traffic. 

One sleep expert did an experiment. He let people sleep for 14 hours a night for a month. After three weeks, they slept about 8 hours a night. This shows they needed more sleep.

In Europe, a university studies sleep. They look at how tiredness affects sailors and how noise at airports disturbs sleep. They also study how tired drivers can be dangerous. 

For their studies, they ask students to help. Students get paid £5 an hour. They change their sleep patterns based on instructions. Some students worry because they wear special equipment on their heads. But the researchers only want to study sleep, not dreams.

In a dark room, there is a driving simulator. Students come in the afternoon when they are usually sleepy. They drive while answering questions. The road looks long and bright. Some students say they will not fall asleep. But one student starts to blink and nod off. He wakes up suddenly, but the car goes off the road. 

Dr. Reyner says drinking coffee can help. Two cups can keep you awake for a while. She suggests energy drinks and gum for more alertness. 

Scientists know that people sleep in cycles. When we sleep, we go through different stages. We dream during light sleep. Our bodies are still, so we do not hurt ourselves. 

Scientists think sleep helps our bodies heal and rest. Women usually sleep longer than men, and older people need less sleep. 

Some researchers say sleep helps us travel through time safely. In the past, people slept differently. A history professor found that in Britain from 1500 to 1850, people went to bed early, woke up after midnight, and then went back to sleep. This time was for thinking and remembering dreams. 

By the 17th century, rich people started to sleep less. The industrial revolution made people work longer hours. 

In some places in the world, people still do not have fixed bedtimes. They sleep for a few hours, wake up, and then sleep again. For some tribes, noises and the need to watch for danger make it hard to sleep all night. 

It seems that many people everywhere need more sleep.

We are talking about big cowboy boots. I stood in my very expensive cowboy boots in the Arizona desert. I wore a cowboy outfit, but I was not a cowboy. I looked at the mountains and felt out of place. I flew in from Denver early in the morning. I thought I looked like a cowboy, but then I saw a real cowboy at the airport. He looked very different from me. 

I used to be a racing driver. I loved it. But now I do not race anymore. I wondered what I should do now. A racing driver should have other jobs to do after racing. I thought of some ideas, but they did not work out. 

Being an "ex" racing driver is hard. People do not want to hear about my past. They do not want to hear stories that end with "almost." Even if I was a champion, people would not want to listen for long. 

I had a good time racing. I made money and had fun. But I miss driving fast cars. I miss the excitement and the people who cared about what I said. Now, I have a lot of free time. 

I looked at the blue sky. There were no big birds flying above me. I saw some small brown birds in a cactus. They seemed to want me to leave. I did not know the desert had songbirds. I realized that I, a fake cowboy in fancy boots, had a lot to learn.

**Vancouver**

In the last ten years, many people from all over the world have moved to Vancouver, in western Canada. In the evening, people walk in the city streets. If you walk with them, you can hear many different languages. People come to Vancouver because it has nice weather, beautiful views of the ocean and mountains, a clean and safe place to live, and good schools and jobs. Some people do not like how fast new buildings are being built, but many new people and tourists have helped the city grow.

Opening a new supermarket used to be a big event in Britain. A famous person, like a soap star or a DJ, would come to cut the ribbon. Now, new supermarkets open every day, and famous people are not needed anymore. Last week, older people waiting in line did not care who opened the new Superbuy store, as long as they were first. A customer said that the first five men to enter would get a bottle of aftershave, and the first five women would get flowers. This news made the people at the front feel happy, and those who came later felt jealous.

The film *Citizen Kane* came out in 1941. Many people talked about it, but it did not make a lot of money. Later, it became popular again on television. This film inspired many people to make their own movies. It was the first film by Orson Welles. Welles said he did not know what he could or could not do, so he just made the film his way. He had a great team with him, including cameraman Gregg Toland and screenwriter Herman J. Mankiewicz. They decided to tell the story of a newspaper owner who was like William Randolph Hearst. Carmel nodded but seemed to not really hear him. Dermot asked her, "Will you be okay? What will you do today?" A study showed that job titles can make people unhappy at work. Many employers and workers think titles create problems between colleagues. The study found that 70% of office workers would give up a pay raise for a better job title. People do not want to be called "subordinate" anymore. Job titles often sound nice, like "specialist" or "coordinator," but they do not really mean much.

**The Vienna Assignment**

I was in Vienna to take photographs. I loved taking pictures. It was my job and my passion. I liked how light looked on different things. A single photo could show a moment in time, a city, or a person. I always hoped to take the perfect picture. I had my camera ready and kept looking for good shots.

Once, I took a photo of smoke from a burning oil well. It was a great picture, and many newspapers wanted it. I felt lucky. After that, I started working for myself. I thought it was a smart choice, but life had other plans. The mid-nineties were not as good as I hoped. That is why I was in Vienna instead of a more exciting place. But I was still taking photos, and I was getting paid. That was good for me.

I got this job by chance. I had taken pictures in London for a book called "Four Cities in Four Seasons." I took photos of London in spring, summer, autumn, and winter. I showed flowers in Hyde Park and busy streets in Piccadilly. But I knew that some of my best photos would not be used. It was just a picture book.

After Christmas, I sent my winter photos to the publishers. They told me that the Austrian photographer, Rudi Schussner, had left the job in Vienna. They asked me to take his place. They liked my work, and I was free to go. I was happy to leave because things were not good at home. A week in snowy Vienna sounded great.

They put me in a hotel in the old city. I had been to Vienna before with my wife, but it was a busy trip. I did not take many photos then. This time, I was alone in January, and I knew it would be different. When I arrived, I saw the beautiful buildings covered in snow. I was excited to take great pictures.

On my first day, I did not take any photos. I rode the trams around the city, getting on and off to enjoy the sights. The weather was cold, but it was beautiful. I wanted to make my own memories of Vienna, not just copy someone else's.

A photograph is a moment in time. You have to wait for the right moment. So, I looked around and waited. The next morning, I woke up early. It had snowed, and the main square, Stephansplatz, was white and quiet. I wanted to take a picture of the big cathedral there. It was tall and wide, and I was not sure how to capture it in one photo. But I knew it could still be magical in the snow.

Photography has always felt special. Even when you understand how it works, it still feels like magic. You can watch a blank piece of paper turn into a photo in a dark room. That feeling of mystery never goes away. Maybe that is why what happened at Stephansplatz that morning did not surprise me.

There is a new art show at the Hayward Gallery in London. This show is about kinetic art. Kinetic art is art that moves or shows movement. The show looks at this type of art from the last 60 years. It has many paintings, drawings, and films. The curator, Guy Brett, has studied kinetic art for a long time. He wants visitors to enjoy the art without too much text or explanations. This way, people can discover things on their own.

David Hockney is a famous artist. Many people like his work. His art is easy to understand because it shows real things. Some people enjoy his art because it helps them escape from daily life. Others like Hockney because he is funny and interesting. Some critics say Hockney is not a great artist. They think he is too popular. But Hockney knows his art is not for everyone. In the last few years, I have seen many art shows. Some are very good, and some are not. I do not like shows that try to push a certain idea. Sometimes, these shows help us see new trends. But often, they feel forced. So, I decided to create a different show called "Window-shopping." I worked with seven artists in an empty warehouse. This show had different artworks that were not connected by a theme. 

For example, Sam Cole made knitted cats that chased each other on a toy train track. Matthew Crawley made a video of him breaking a camera. These artworks are very different, but they can still be shown together. They do not bother each other and can even help each other look better.

**Art History**

Some people love paintings but do not want to think too much about them. They worry that thinking will ruin their enjoyment. Some art historians focus too much on theory and forget the joy of looking at art. This is like knowing how to cook a dish but not enjoying the taste. 

It is important to enjoy art, but knowing more about it can also make it more enjoyable. Our feelings about art are influenced by the society we live in. What we like is not just about our genes or personalities. It is also about the values of our culture. While it is important to feel and enjoy art, thinking about it can also be valuable.

Studying the past is hard because it is gone. The people who lived long ago are not here anymore. We cannot ask them about their lives. Archaeology gives us some clues, but we cannot do experiments on them. However, we can use computer modelling. This means we can create pictures of old places and make virtual people who act like real humans. We can set rules and see how these digital people live. To keep the strange monkey away, the strong male made a plan. When the strange monkey came close, the strong male made a loud alarm call. This call means there is a leopard nearby. The strange monkey got scared and went back to the trees. The strong male did this many times.

**Cats and Their Prey**

In a village in England, people counted what their cats caught. In one year, seventy cats caught over 1,000 animals. A professor in America thought that all cats in Britain might catch 100 million birds and small animals each year! 

But this number is not realistic. Most cats live in towns and catch fewer animals than the cats in the village. The important question is: can the bird population survive? The answer is yes. In winter, many people feed birds, and there are many places for birds to nest. So, cats are hunters, but they do not destroy the bird population in Britain.

Buffaloes are very important to the marshmen. Every morning, the buffaloes wake up and slowly leave their sleeping place. They go to the water. 

At first, they stand and groan, tired from the night. Then, the leader buffalo steps into the water. Once in the water, they relax and forget what they were doing. They stay in the water for a long time, making low sounds.

**Picasso's Painting**

Pablo Picasso painted many things around him. In 1940, he painted fish while staying in a fishing town. The painting shows a fish seller's table with a crab and some fish. 

The fish look alive, but the painting is hard to understand. Picasso used flat shapes and soft colors. It looks calm, like being underwater. But there is a feeling of danger. The fish seem ready to fight the crab. The painting shows both calmness and a hint of violence.

**Photography**

Photography is a way to take pictures of life and activities. It has been around for about 150 years. With photography, we can see many things, like nature, space, and people’s lives. It helps us understand the world better.

Before photography, people made pictures a long time ago. The first pictures were cave paintings from about 35,000 years ago. We do not know exactly why people made these paintings. They might have shown hunting, been for magic, or just for fun. Pictures have always been important in human culture.

When photography was invented in the 1800s, it changed how we see things. People thought photographs showed the truth. The camera works like our eyes and can take a picture of what we see. This made photography very special.

Some people believe that everyone can understand photographs, no matter where they are from. For example, a person in a remote area could understand a picture of the sun and moon. But as the world changed, we started to wonder if everyone really understands photographs the same way.

Photography is often seen as a clear way to show reality. For example, someone can show a picture and say, "This is my grandson." Since photography started in 1839, it has changed a lot. At first, it was just a way to keep memories. Now, photographs are also important historical documents. They tell us about the people and society that made them.

Photography can also help bring change in society. For example, during the Italian Renaissance, new ways of seeing things changed art. Today, photography is a big part of our media culture and shows us the real problems in the world.

**How to Write Poetry**

Writing poetry is fun, but it can be hard. It is important to read a lot and write a lot. This helps your imagination. Some people write poems when they feel safe. Others write when they are sad. Some people write poems at a certain time. Others wait for a good idea. All ways are okay if they help you write.

When you write, listen to your inner voice. Take care of it and let it grow. One day, it will be strong enough to help you write.

**The Short Story**

In a short story, do not use too many characters or long descriptions. Flashbacks should be short and only used when needed. A memory can help the story move forward, but it should not stop the action.

Dialogue is important. Two people talking can show different sides of a story quickly. This keeps the reader interested. Writing too much can ruin a short story. Every word should count. A short story needs conflict and action, just like a novel.

**Screenplays**

Writing a screenplay for a film is like playing chess. You may not know what will happen next, but you keep moving. As you play more, you learn to see the whole game, not just one move. You start to see patterns in the game.

People naturally learn to speak, but writing is different. Charles Darwin said that language is a human instinct, but writing is not. All children learn to speak without lessons. If children do not have a language, they make one up. 

Writing systems were created a long time ago in some societies. Most children did not learn to read or write in the past. Even today, some children find it hard to learn. Children are good at listening, but learning to write takes time and effort. We need to understand how writing works and how children learn.

I am starting a book, but I feel unsure about it. I call it a novel, but I am not sure if it is really a novel. I do not have a big story to tell. There is no death or marriage at the end. I leave the reader wondering. This book is about my memories of a man I met sometimes, but I do not know much about his life. **POETRY RECITALS**

Poetry recitals are events where people read poems out loud. Many people today feel confused about poetry. There are many types of poetry and different ways to write and share it. Some poets write poems to be read on paper. Other poets like to perform their poems for an audience.

In the last twenty years, poetry readings have become more popular. Small groups in towns hold these events in places like village halls or homes. Schools and colleges invite poets to read their work to students. Arts festivals also have poetry readings with famous poets.

For poets who perform, these events are good. Their poems are often simple and easy to understand. People can enjoy them right away. But for poets who write more complex poems, it can be hard. Many people may not understand their work if they hear it for the first time.

Listening to poetry is different from reading it. Hearing a poet read their work can help people understand it better. It is good if the audience has the text to follow along or knows the poems before the reading.

Popular poetry events can help people enjoy poetry. They can see that poetry is fun and not just for a few special people. Sometimes, these events even include music, like jazz, to make it more enjoyable.

**Oral History**  
Oral history is when historians use people's stories to learn about the past. But this can be hard. A person's story is not always true. When someone talks to a historian, both people can change how they feel and what they say. The historian chooses who to talk to and what to ask about. Even if the historian just listens, their presence can change the story. The historian's background can also affect the story. The person telling the story may not remember everything correctly. Their memories can be mixed with things they saw on TV or how they feel now. Sometimes, they remember the past with good feelings or bad feelings. These feelings can change the truth of the story.

**Animal Science**  
Animal science studies how animals live and behave. There are two main ways to study animals: looking at how their bodies work and looking at how they act as a whole. Some scientists study how animals learn in labs, usually with rats and pigeons. Others study animals in nature to see how they behave without learning. Both ways are important. Understanding how animals behave is different from just knowing how their bodies work. For example, if we want to know how a bird builds a nest, we cannot just look at its nerves. We need to see the whole bird and how it acts.

**The Social Sciences**  
When students start studying social sciences, they have to learn two things at once. They need to learn about the subject and how to study it. This means they must understand the facts and also how to find and organize this information. Social sciences are about people and society, but they are more than just common sense. Each social science looks at different parts of life and uses special methods to study them. These methods and ideas help scientists understand society better.

**Classical Architecture**  
In Ancient Greece and Rome, architecture was more than just building. The Roman architect Vitruvius said architecture is about order, arrangement, proportion, and beauty. He did not talk about how useful a building is at first. He focused on how it looks. Before classical architecture, people built simple homes. These homes were not very artistic, but they helped create the ideas for later buildings. Even though classical temples look fancy, they are based on simple, one-room homes.
